concept.title: Terminology, internal services, and concepts
concept.shortdesc: This section defines terminology, internal services that enable to function, and concepts that are used in this guide and other documentation.

dlentry.dd: A collection of one or more software programs that have been converted into Docker containers.
The collection of hosts in one or more resource pools.
A host that runs the application services scheduled for the resource pool to which it belongs. A system can be configured as delegate or master.
An open-source application for building, shipping, and running distributed applications.
( internal service) A distributed, real-time search and analytics engine. uses it to index log files and store service definitions.
( internal service) A log file collector and aggregator that forwards parsed log file entries to Elasticsearch.

The host that runs the application services scheduler, the Docker registry, the distributed file system, and other internal services, including the server for the browser interface. A system can be configured as delegate or master. Only one system in a cluster can be the master.
( internal service) A time series database that uses to store its service performance metrics.

A collection of one or more hosts, each with its own compute, network, and storage resources. The name of the default resource pool is default. uses resource pools (except the default pool) to run services on specific hosts.
A process and its supporting files that runs in a single container to provide specific functionality as part of an application.
The name of the service and a command-line client for interacting with the service.
( internal service) A centralized service that uses for configuration maintenance, naming, distributed synchronization, and providing group services.
